question: Would you like to share your wishes about continuing or stopping medical treatments if your condition changes significantly?

options.label: Fully documented and communicated to all relevant parties
Discussed with family but not formally documented
Thought about it but haven't discussed or documented
Avoided thinking about these issues
Too overwhelmed to consider these decisions

followup_questions.question: Have you documented these wishes in an advance care directive or discussed them with anyone?
Which factors are most important to you when deciding whether to continue treatment or stop treatment?
options: Maintaining quality of life and comfort
Not being a burden to family

followup_questions.question: What additional support or information would help you feel more confident about these decisions?
options: Advice or guidance from your doctors
Talking with others who have faced similar decisions
I feel I have enough support

question: Who would you want to make medical decisions on your behalf if you were unable to communicate?

options.label: Fully documented and communicated to all relevant parties
Discussed with family but not formally documented
Thought about it but haven't discussed or documented
Avoided thinking about these issues
Too overwhelmed to consider these decisions

followup_questions.question: Have you formally designated this person
Does this person fully understand your wishes and values regarding your care?
Do you feel comfortable with this choice of decision-maker, or are there any concerns you'd like to discuss?

question: How has your breathing been lately?

options.label: Breathing normally without any issues
Mild shortness of breath with strenuous activity
Noticeable breathing difficulties with light activity or at rest
Severe breathing difficulties requiring frequent rest or assistance
Very difficult to breathe even at rest

followup_questions.question: Do you find yourself avoiding activities or positions because of breathlessness?
Do you use any breathing support (like a ventilator or breathing exercises)?
options: Yes – I use non-invasive ventilation (e.g., BiPAP) part-time
Yes – I use non-invasive ventilation most of the time
Yes – I have a tracheostomy or full-time ventilation
No – I don't use breathing support

followup_questions.question: Would you like help with strategies or devices to improve your breathing or comfort?

question: How are you communicating with others currently, and are you able to make yourself understood?

options.label: Communicating normally without issues
Mild communication difficulties (repeat occasionally)
Moderate difficulty (need alternative methods or frequent repetition)
Severe communication difficulty (hard to be understood even with aids)
Unable to communicate effectively

followup_questions.question: Do you find that people often have trouble understanding you when you speak?
Are you using any tools or devices to help with communication (like an AAC device, writing things down, etc.)?
Would you like to explore more communication aids or techniques to help you express yourself?

question: Do you have trouble finding the right words or keeping up with conversations, and if so, how often does that happen?

options.label: No trouble communicating thoughts or words
Occasional trouble finding words
Frequent pauses or substitutions needed
Significant difficulty communicating ideas or words
Unable to reliably express thoughts in words

followup_questions.question: Is it getting harder for you to follow conversations or respond quickly?
Do you feel your mind gets stuck or slowed down when you try to communicate?
Would you like to discuss strategies or tools to help with cognitive communication challenges?

question: Are you having any difficulty with swallowing or eating?

options.label: Eating and swallowing normally
Mild difficulty (coughing occasionally when eating)
Moderate difficulty (needing food modifications or more time)
Severe difficulty (choking risk, mostly purees/liquids)
Unable to swallow safely (tube feeding needed or in place)

followup_questions.question: Have you noticed certain foods or textures are more difficult to swallow?
Are you doing anything to help make swallowing easier (like chin tuck, eating softer foods)?
Would you like to discuss strategies or get help from a specialist (like a speech therapist) for swallowing issues?

question: How are you getting around these days? Have you experienced any changes in your mobility?

options.label: Moving around as usual without help
Minor changes (occasional unsteadiness or slow down)
Moderate changes (need some support or devices)
Significant changes (mostly need wheelchair or assistance)
Unable to move around without full assistance

followup_questions.question: Do you use any devices or aids for mobility (cane, walker, wheelchair)?
options: Yes – occasionally (for longer distances or uneven ground)
Yes – regularly (around the house or daily)
Yes – always (cannot get around without them)

followup_questions.question: Have you experienced any falls recently?
Would you like to discuss exercises or therapies that might help with strength or mobility?

question: Do you have any concerns about your privacy or confidentiality regarding your health information and personal matters?

options.label: No privacy or confidentiality concerns
Minor concerns (occasionally worry about who knows what)
Some concerns (careful about sharing info with certain people)
Significant concerns (actively limiting what I share)
Extremely concerned (almost no one is informed due to fear of privacy loss)

followup_questions.question: Have you set any specific preferences for who can access your medical information or updates about your condition?
Is there any information you feel uncomfortable sharing with certain people or in certain settings?
Would you like help understanding how your information is kept private or setting boundaries around who gets updates?

question: Are there any issues or changes with your employment payroll or income that you are concerned about due to your condition?

options.label: No concerns or difficulties
Minor concerns, well managed
Moderate difficulties affecting quality of life
Severe difficulties, major life impact
Extreme difficulties, overwhelming burden

followup_questions.question: Have you been able to manage any necessary paperwork or adjustments to your payroll or income (like medical leave forms, disability claims)?
Do you need any assistance understanding your pay, benefits, or any compensation you might be entitled to?
Would it help to talk to someone about job protection, financial planning, or other resources if work is affected?

question: How is your health insurance coverage working out for you? Are there any issues or concerns with your insurance?

options.label: Insurance covers everything, no issues
Minor issues (some small claims or approvals delays)
Moderate issues (multiple delays or significant out-of-pocket costs)
Serious issues (denials or large expenses causing concern)
Insurance is not covering needs (or no insurance)

followup_questions.question: Have you faced any denied claims or difficulties getting certain treatments or services covered?
Do you understand your insurance benefits, or would you like some help reviewing what is covered?
Would you be interested in resources or assistance for dealing with insurance appeals or financial aid programs?

question: Have you handled the legal documents or decisions that might be needed due to your condition (like power of attorney, wills, or similar)?

options.label: All relevant legal matters are settled and in place
Most major documents are done; a few remain
Started on some, but important documents still pending
Haven't addressed these legal matters yet
Overwhelmed by legal planning; nothing is prepared

followup_questions.question: Have you designated someone to handle your affairs (financial, health decisions) if you become unable to?
Do you have a will or trust in place, or have you thought about setting one up?
Would you like resources or assistance to help with legal planning (e.g., meeting with a legal advisor)?

question: How is communication between your different healthcare providers and caregivers? Is everyone on the same page regarding your care?

options.label: All providers and caregivers are well-coordinated
Minor coordination issues (occasionally need to repeat info)
Some coordination gaps (providers not always updated)
Major coordination problems (often confusion or missed info)
No coordination (providers/caregivers not communicating at all)

followup_questions.question: Have you ever had to act as the go-between for your doctors or care team to share information?
Is there a primary point person (like a care coordinator or one doctor) who oversees or helps manage your overall care plan?
Would it help to have more structured communication or a tool (like a shared care plan or meetings) to ensure everyone stays updated?

question: Has your body image or the way you feel about your appearance changed with your condition?

options.label: No change in how I feel about my appearance
A little more self-conscious but managing
Some negative feelings about changes in appearance
Strong negative feelings about my body or appearance
Extremely uncomfortable with my appearance now

followup_questions.question: Are there specific changes (like weight loss, muscle loss, assistive devices) that have impacted how you feel about your appearance?
Have you done anything to help adjust to these changes (like new clothing styles, talking about it with someone)?
Would you like resources or support to help with body image or confidence (for example, counseling or support groups)?

question: Have you noticed any changes in your memory or difficulty remembering things recently?

options.label: Memory is as good as before, no issues
Sometimes forget minor things (names, where items are)
Noticeable memory lapses (miss appointments, important details)
Significant memory issues (require reminders or help often)
Severe memory loss affecting daily life

followup_questions.question: Do you use any tools or strategies to help you remember things (like calendars, alarms, notes)?
Have these memory changes affected your daily routines or safety (for example, forgetting to turn off appliances)?
Would you be interested in discussing ways to manage memory issues or having an evaluation for memory changes?

question: Has your speech or the way you talk changed, and if so, how understandable is your speech to others now?

options.label: Speech is normal and clear
Slight changes (people ask me to repeat occasionally)
Moderate changes (frequent repetition needed, some words slurred)
Significant changes (speech often unclear even to family)
Very hard to speak or be understood

followup_questions.question: Do you feel you’re speaking more slowly or differently than before?
Are people close to you noticing changes in your speech clarity?
Have you considered or started using speech therapy or aids (like speech exercises or communication devices) to help?

question: How are you managing stress and emotional challenges related to your condition?

options.label: Managing stress well, have effective coping strategies
Mild stress, generally coping okay
Moderate stress, having difficulty at times
High stress, struggling to cope
Extreme stress, not managing well at all

followup_questions.question: What do you currently do to help manage your stress (e.g., hobbies, relaxation techniques, talking to someone)?
options: Talking with friends/family or support group

followup_questions.question: Have your stress levels increased as your condition has changed?
Would you like additional support or resources for managing stress (like counseling, stress management workshops)?

question: Are you finding time and ability to engage in hobbies or activities that you enjoy?

options.label: Can still enjoy all my hobbies/activities fully
Can do most hobbies with minor adjustments
Have had to give up or cut back on several hobbies
Unable to participate in most previous hobbies
Cannot engage in any hobbies I used to enjoy

followup_questions.question: Have you had to modify how you do any of your hobbies to continue doing them (like using adaptive equipment or finding new approaches)?
Are there any new hobbies or activities you've taken up that suit you better now?
Would you be interested in exploring new activities or hobbies that align with your current abilities and interests?

question: Has your condition affected your intimate relationships or sexual activity in ways that concern you?

options.label: No effect on intimacy or sexual activity
Minor changes but we’re adapting
Moderate changes causing some concern or difficulty
Significant impact on intimacy, causing distress
Severe disruption to intimacy/sexual activity

followup_questions.question: Are there specific physical challenges affecting intimacy (like muscle weakness, breathing difficulty)?
Have you been able to communicate with your partner about these changes?
Would you be interested in resources or speaking with a professional about maintaining intimacy and connection?

question: How is your social life and interaction with friends or community? Has your condition affected your social activities?

options.label: Social life unchanged, still very active
Slight reduction in social activities
Moderate reduction, sometimes feel isolated
Major reduction, often feel isolated
No social interaction, completely isolated

followup_questions.question: Do you find it harder to go out or join gatherings because of your condition?
Have friends or community members been able to accommodate your needs (like meeting at accessible places or helping with transportation)?
Would you like support in finding social activities or groups that are more accessible or understanding of your situation?

question: Has your condition affected your spiritual or religious life (for better or worse), and is that something you think about or need support with?

options.label: No change in spiritual/religious life; it’s steady
Some positive effects (faith or perspective deepened)
Some challenges (struggling with meaning or faith at times)
Significant struggles (feeling disconnected or questioning faith often)
Profound crisis of faith or spiritual distress

followup_questions.question: Do you have any spiritual or religious practices that you continue, or have they changed since your diagnosis?
Are you connected with any community or support (like a faith community or spiritual counselor) that you find helpful?
Would you like assistance finding spiritual support or addressing spiritual concerns related to your condition?

question: How are your caregivers coping, and are you comfortable with the care you receive from them?

options.label: Caregivers coping well and I am comfortable
Minor stress for caregivers but managing
Some concerns about caregiver stress or care quality
High caregiver stress or issues with care quality
Caregivers overwhelmed or care needs not being met

followup_questions.question: Do you sense that any of your caregivers are feeling burnt out or overwhelmed?
Are there any aspects of your care that you feel could be improved or that you’re not entirely comfortable with?
Would you like help with finding additional caregiving support, respite care, or resources to help your caregivers cope?

question: Do any of your family members, who are also your caregivers, have health issues of their own or other responsibilities that affect their ability to care for you?

options.label: No, all caregivers are healthy and fully available
Minor issues (caregivers have some other duties but manage)
Some issues (caregivers juggle health or duties, some strain)
Major issues (caregivers’ health/other duties significantly limit care)
Caregivers unable to provide needed care due to their own issues

followup_questions.question: Are any of your caregivers dealing with their own health problems or limitations?
Do your caregivers have other significant responsibilities (jobs, children to care for) that sometimes conflict with caring for you?
Would additional support (like professional caregivers or respite services) be helpful if your family caregivers are stretched thin?

question: Have you experienced any changes in your relationships with friends or family who help care for you, possibly in terms of roles or dynamics?

options.label: No major changes in relationships or dynamics
Minor changes, but nothing concerning
Some noticeable changes (e.g., roles shifting, some tension)
Significant changes (strain in relationship, role reversal issues)
Relationship dynamics severely strained

followup_questions.question: Have any tensions or conflicts arisen with those who care for you, possibly because of stress or misunderstandings?
Do you talk openly with your caregivers about how each of you is feeling regarding the care situation?
Would it be helpful to have a family meeting or counseling to address any relationship stresses related to caregiving?

question: Are any of your caregivers younger family members (like children or teenagers), and if so, how are they coping with their role?

options.label: No concerns or difficulties
Minor concerns, well managed
Moderate difficulties affecting quality of life
Severe difficulties, major life impact
Extreme difficulties, overwhelming burden

followup_questions.question: What tasks are your younger caregivers helping you with?
options: They are not involved in caregiving tasks

followup_questions.question: What concerns do you have about your young caregivers’ situation?
options: I worry some tasks may be too difficult or inappropriate for them
I’m concerned they don’t have enough emotional support
I don’t have major concerns – they seem to be managing

followup_questions.question: Would you like assistance in finding resources or support groups for young caregivers to help them not feel alone in this?

question: How prepared do you feel to handle emergencies related to your condition?

options.label: Fully prepared and practiced
options.qol_impact: 100% - No impact on quality of life

options.label: Partially prepared (draft plan)
Aware but unprepared
Not prepared at all (no plan)
Too overwhelmed to consider planning

followup_questions.question: Which key elements are currently ready? (Select all that apply)
What barriers, if any, limit your preparedness? (Select all that apply)

question: How much does your condition limit your ability to travel or go out?

options.label: No travel limitations
options.qol_impact: 100% - No impact on quality of life

options.label: Mostly independent travel
Can manage some aspects independently
Travel only with full assistance
Cannot travel at all

followup_questions.question: Which supports did you use? (Select all that apply)
options: Having a companion/caregiver assist during travel

followup_questions.question: How many trips did you complete in the past 7 days?

question: How is your ability to get in and out of bed, chairs, or cars?

options.label: No issues transferring in/out
Minor difficulties (need a bit more time or some setup)
Moderate difficulties (need some physical help or device)
Severe difficulties (need full assistance for transfers)
Unable to transfer without mechanical lift or complete assistance

followup_questions.question: Which transfers require help? (Select all that apply)
What could improve safety or ease of transfers? (Select all that apply)
options: Physical therapy or exercises for strength
Assistive devices (like transfer boards or lift)

followup_questions.question: Do you feel any pain or fear during transfers?

question: How accessible and safe is your home for you?

options.label: Home is fully accessible and safe
Mostly accessible, minor adjustments needed
Some inaccessible areas, moderate fall risk or challenges
Home has significant accessibility issues or hazards
Home is not at all suited to my needs now

followup_questions.question: What changes (if any) have you made to your home? (Select all that apply)
Do you feel safe moving around at home, or have you had any close calls or falls due to the setup?
Would you like information or assistance on home modifications or accessibility tools?

question: How are you managing household tasks like cleaning, cooking, and home maintenance?

options.label: Managing all household tasks independently
Some tasks need minor help or take longer
Many tasks require assistance or outsourcing
Unable to do most tasks, heavily reliant on others
Cannot do any household tasks

followup_questions.question: Which tasks have become challenging? (Select all that apply)
Do you have help or services for these tasks (family, hired help, meal services)?
Would you like information on services or support for household tasks (like cleaning services, meal delivery)?

question: Do you have reliable transportation for your appointments and errands?

options.label: Yes, transportation is not an issue
Minor issues (occasional scheduling problems)
Some issues (frequent difficulty arranging rides)
Major issues (often miss appointments or rely heavily on others)
No reliable transportation available

followup_questions.question: How do you usually get to your appointments or go out for errands? (Select all that apply)
Have you missed appointments or important events due to lack of transportation?
Would you like help finding transportation options (e.g., community shuttles, volunteer driver programs)?

question: Are you able to manage your medications (like remembering to take them and getting refills) without issues?

options.label: Managing medications perfectly on my own
Occasional lapses (miss a dose once in a while)
Some difficulty (need reminders or help to keep track)
Significant difficulty (frequently miss doses or struggle with management)
Cannot manage medications without assistance

followup_questions.question: Do you use any tools to help (like pill organizers, alarms, apps)?
Has it been harder to swallow pills or handle medication packaging?
Would you like to discuss strategies or services (like a visiting nurse or pill delivery) to help manage your medications?

question: Do you feel you can easily reach your healthcare providers when you need to (for appointments, questions, or emergencies)?

options.label: Yes, always easy to reach providers
Usually easy, with occasional delays
Sometimes difficult (often wait or struggle to get responses)
Often very difficult to reach providers when needed
Cannot reach providers in a timely way at all

followup_questions.question: How do you usually contact your healthcare team (phone, email, patient portal), and does that work for you?
options: Through a caregiver or family member

followup_questions.question: Have you had any urgent issues where you felt you couldn’t get help quickly?
Would you like information on how to better reach your care team or on any 24/7 support lines available?

question: Are you aware of or using any care coordination services (like a case manager or nurse coordinator) to help manage your care?

options.label: Yes, I have effective care coordination support
Somewhat – informal coordination or occasional help
Not really – I mostly coordinate things myself
No, and it’s hard managing appointments/care on my own
I was not aware of such services at all

followup_questions.question: Do you have a designated person (like a social worker or nurse) who helps schedule appointments or connect you with resources?
Have you found it challenging to keep track of different appointments, medications, or recommendations on your own?

question: How are you managing financially with the medical expenses or changes in income related to your condition?

options.label: Managing well financially, no significant strain
Some strain, but handling it with adjustments
Moderate financial strain, some bills or needs are challenging
Severe financial strain, struggling to afford care or essentials
Financially overwhelmed (unable to afford many needs)

followup_questions.question: Have medical bills or costs for equipment/care been a significant problem recently?
Are you aware of or using any financial assistance programs (like disability benefits, charities)?
Would speaking with a social worker or financial counselor help you navigate the financial aspects of your care?

question: How are you sleeping at night? Have you had any issues with sleep lately?

options.label: Sleeping well without major issues
Some problems with sleep but not severe
Not sleeping well (significant issues, some daytime fatigue)
Severe sleep issues (frequent insomnia, heavy fatigue)
Hardly sleeping at all (extreme insomnia)

followup_questions.question: Do you have trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or do you wake up not feeling rested?
options: Yes – waking up frequently during the night
No – I don’t have those issues

followup_questions.question: Have you noticed if symptoms like difficulty breathing, anxiety, or muscle discomfort are affecting your sleep?
options: Yes – breathing issues disturb my sleep
Yes – anxiety or worries disturb my sleep
Yes – pain or discomfort affects my sleep
No – none of these symptoms significantly affect my sleep

followup_questions.question: Is there any help you need to improve your sleep (like medication, better bedding, or a bedtime routine)?
options: Yes – possibly medication to help sleep
Yes – better bedding or pillow arrangements
Yes – help establishing a better bedtime routine
No – I don’t need any special help with sleep

options.label: No insomnia issues; sleeping fine
Some difficulty sleeping but it's manageable

Significant insomnia affecting daily life (e.g., severe fatigue)
Extreme insomnia, barely able to sleep at all

Aware of exercises but rarely do them
Not doing any such exercises/techniques
Never heard of these techniques

followup_questions.question: What strategies did you use to relieve breathlessness?

question: If you use supplemental oxygen, how often do you use it and is it helping?

options.label: Using oxygen as needed, effectively relieves symptoms
Using occasionally, seems to help somewhat
Using regularly but only partially helps
Using it but not noticing much benefit
Prescribed or have oxygen but not using it

followup_questions.question: Any difficulties with mask fit, pressure, or maintenance?

question: If you have a feeding tube (PEG tube) in place, how comfortable are you with its care and is it working well for you?

options.label: Feeding tube care is easy, nutrition is good
Managing tube mostly fine, minor issues
Some issues with tube or feeding (occasional discomfort or nutrition concern)
Significant issues (frequent discomfort, infections, or nutrition deficits)
Tube feeding not meeting needs or very problematic

followup_questions.question: Any difficulties with swallowing, tube management, or nutrition balance?

question: If you use any mobility aids (cane, walker, wheelchair), do you feel they are giving you enough independence?

options.label: Yes, aids fully support my independence
Mostly – minor limitations remain
Somewhat – still fairly dependent on help
Not really – still very dependent even with aids
No – aids do not cover my needs

followup_questions.question: What barriers, if any, limited your independence in mobility?

question: If you have a home ventilation or suction machine, are you able to use it or get help using it when needed?

options.label: N/A or always able to use/get help with equipment
Usually yes, occasionally small delays
Sometimes have trouble or wait for help
Often unable to use when needed (lack of help or hard to operate)
Cannot use equipment when needed at all

followup_questions.question: Are there times you wished you had someone immediately to help with your equipment (like at night or when alone)?
Do you feel you have been trained enough to operate your equipment (or your caregivers have been trained)?
Would an emergency call system or on-call nursing support make you feel more secure in managing these devices?

question: Have you had to adjust how you take care of your hair or other personal grooming because of your condition?

options.label: No concerns or difficulties
Minor concerns, well managed
Moderate difficulties affecting quality of life
Severe difficulties, major life impact
Extreme difficulties, overwhelming burden

followup_questions.question: Is it getting harder to do things like combing your hair, shaving, or other grooming activities on your own?
Do you have someone to assist with your grooming, or have you found tools that make these activities easier?
options: Yes – a caregiver/family member helps me
Yes – I use adaptive tools for grooming
No – I handle grooming by myself

followup_questions.question: Are there any aspects of personal grooming you miss or struggle with, where some support might improve how you feel?

question: Have you encountered any issues with bathing or showering, and do you feel safe and comfortable while doing so?

options.label: No issues, bathing independently and safely
Minor issues (use some bath aids but feel okay)
Moderate issues (need help for certain tasks or feel a bit unsafe)
Severe issues (cannot bathe without full assistance; safety concerns)
Not bathing without assistance at all

followup_questions.question: Do you use any special equipment (bath chair, grab bars) to help with bathing?
Do you feel at risk of falling or have any fear when bathing?
Would you like to explore more solutions for safe and comfortable bathing (like different equipment or home modifications)?

question: Have you been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless recently?

options.label: Not at all, mood is generally good
A little bit, occasionally down
Yes, more than half the days feeling down
Yes, most days I feel depressed
Yes, nearly every day feeling hopeless

followup_questions.question: Have you lost interest or pleasure in activities you usually enjoy?
Have you considered talking to a mental health professional or support group about these feelings?
Would you like resources for coping with feelings of depression (like counseling, therapy, or medication)?

question: How often have you been bothered by feeling anxious, nervous, or on edge in recent weeks?

options.label: Not at all
Several days (mild, occasional anxiety)
More than half the days (noticeable anxiety)
Nearly every day (persistent anxiety)
Every day, throughout the day (extreme anxiety)

followup_questions.question: Do these anxious feelings interfere with your daily life or sleep?
Have you found any strategies that help when you feel anxious (like breathing exercises, meditation, or medication)?
Would you like to discuss ways to manage anxiety or get support for it?

question: In the past couple of weeks, how often have you felt overwhelmed or unable to cope with your situation?

options.label: Not at all; coping well
Rarely; mostly managing
Sometimes; it’s been tough at times
Often; feeling overwhelmed frequently
Nearly constantly; feeling unable to cope

followup_questions.question: Have there been specific triggers or moments that made you feel this way?
Do you have someone to talk to or activities that help when you feel overwhelmed?
Are you interested in additional support for coping, such as counseling or support groups?

question: I know you enjoyed knitting – is knitting (or similar crafts) still something you enjoy, and are you able to continue doing it?

options.label: Fully independent in all activities
Need occasional help with complex tasks
Need regular help with daily activities
Need extensive help with most activities
Completely dependent for all care

followup_questions.question: Have you had to give up knitting, or have you found ways to adapt (like someone assisting or switching to a different craft)?
Is there anything you miss about knitting that we could look into adapting or replacing with a similar hobby?
Would you like to find or learn about any assistive tools or techniques that might allow you to continue with such hobbies?

question: Has your condition impacted your ability to enjoy going out to restaurants or events, and how much does that bother you?

options.label: Not at all; I still enjoy going out as before
A little; I go out but with some adjustments
Somewhat; I’ve reduced how often or need significant planning
A lot; I rarely go out to such places now
Completely; I no longer go out to restaurants or events

followup_questions.question: Are there specific challenges (like accessibility, fatigue, dietary needs) that make going out difficult?
Do you have someone to go out with who can assist you if needed, or do you prefer staying in now?
Would you be interested in finding alternatives (like accessible events or in-home experiences) to still have enjoyable outings?

question: Do you still enjoy reading, and have you had to adjust how you read (for example, by using audiobooks or e-readers)?

options.label: Can read as usual without adjustments
Use some adaptations (like larger print or audiobooks) but still enjoy reading
Reading has become difficult, do it much less
Rarely read now due to difficulty
Don’t read at all anymore

followup_questions.question: Have you switched to audiobooks, text-to-speech, or other methods to continue enjoying books?
Are vision changes, hand fatigue, or another issue the main challenge with reading?
Would you like suggestions for accessible reading materials or technologies (like audio libraries, specialized e-readers)?

question: Is the possibility of needing hospice or end-of-life care something you've thought about or want to plan for?

options.label: Yes, I’ve considered and planned for it
I have thought about it but details aren’t settled
Only brief thoughts; no plans yet
Haven’t really thought about it; uncomfortable with the topic
Not at all; I avoid thinking about it entirely

followup_questions.question: Have you had any discussions with family or doctors about your preferences for end-of-life care?
Do you have any particular fears or concerns about end-of-life care (like being at home vs hospital, comfort, etc.)?
Would you like information on hospice care or palliative care services, just to be prepared if needed?

question: Do you have any plans in case your primary caregiver(s) become unable to care for you (for example, backup care arrangements)?

options.label: Yes, backup care plans are in place
Have some informal backup options in mind
Thought about it but no concrete plan
No plan yet; would be difficult if caregiver unavailable
Never considered this scenario

followup_questions.question: Do you have more than one person who knows how to care for you if needed?
Have you considered short-term respite care or nursing services as a backup?
Would you like to discuss creating a backup plan for care (for peace of mind)?

question: How are your relationships with close friends or family? Are you getting the emotional support you need?

options.label: Very supportive, emotionally and practically
Supportive overall, with some minor gaps
Somewhat strained or not as present as before
Strained, I feel lacking support
Very strained or distant, no support from them

followup_questions.question: Have you felt any friends or family pulling away since your condition changed?
Do you feel comfortable talking about your challenges with your friends or family?
Would you be interested in connecting with a support group or counselor to get more emotional support?

question: How are your family members coping with your condition? Are they getting support as well?

options.label: Family coping well and have support
Some stress but they’re managing
Noticeable stress; they could use some support
Family is struggling to cope
Family not coping at all; very overwhelmed

followup_questions.question: Have any family members expressed feeling overwhelmed or unsure how to help?
Do your family members have their own support system or someone to talk to about how they feel?
Would you be interested in family counseling or support groups for families dealing with similar situations?

question: Have you set any personal goals or projects for yourself despite the illness, and how is your progress with them?

options.label: Yes, actively pursuing goals/projects successfully
Yes, with some adjustments or slowing down
Have goals, but progress is quite slow or stalled
Struggling to pursue any goals right now
No goals or projects; just getting through each day

followup_questions.question: Is there something new you’ve taken up or wanted to accomplish recently?
Do you feel you have the support and resources you need to work on your personal goals?
Would you like to talk about finding new goals or adapting old ones to your current situation?

question: Have you thought about creating any keepsakes, writing down memories, or doing something to share your life story with loved ones?

options.label: Yes, I have done or am doing this actively
I’ve started or have plans to do so
I’ve thought about it but not started yet
Not really, unsure how or not a priority
No interest in this at all

followup_questions.question: Are there specific memories or messages you’d want to leave for friends or family?
Have you considered creating things like photo albums, recordings, letters, or a journal?
Would you like support or ideas on how to capture and share your experiences (like guided memoir writing, video recordings)?

question: Are you or your loved ones experiencing anticipatory grief (grieving in advance), and would you want support for that?

options.label: Yes, experiencing it and seeking support
Yes, feeling it but managing without outside support
Not experiencing that kind of grief yet
Unsure if what we feel is anticipatory grief
No, not experiencing it at all

followup_questions.question: Do you notice feelings of grief or sadness about what you or your family anticipate in the future?
Have you or your family sought any counseling or support groups for coping with this kind of grief?
Would you be open to resources or support to help cope with these feelings?

question: How are you coping with changes in what you can do (like losses of abilities or independence)?

options.label: Coping well with losses; I’ve come to terms
Coping okay, though it’s hard sometimes
Struggling at times to cope with these changes
Often very upset by what I can no longer do
Not coping well at all with these losses

followup_questions.question: Are there particular activities or abilities you miss the most?
Have you found any new activities or roles that give you a sense of purpose despite these changes?
Would you be interested in talking to someone (counselor or peer) about how you feel regarding these changes?

question: What gives you a sense of fulfillment or joy these days?

options.label: I have many sources of joy/fulfillment
I have some activities or people that bring me joy
A few moments of joy, but it’s limited
Rarely feel fulfillment; struggling to find joy
I don’t feel much joy or fulfillment anymore

followup_questions.question: Is there something you look forward to each day or week, like a visit, hobby, or routine?
Have your sources of joy changed since your diagnosis (for example, finding joy in smaller things or different activities)?
Would you like help finding new activities or opportunities that might bring fulfillment (like adaptive hobbies, music, art, etc.)?

question: Are you still able to enjoy art or creative activities as you used to (for example, painting, drawing, music)?

options.label: Yes, I can still enjoy them the same way
I enjoy them but have adapted how I do them
I enjoy them less because it’s become difficult
I can barely engage in those activities now
No, I can’t do those activities anymore

followup_questions.question: Have you switched to enjoying art or music in different ways (like listening instead of playing, using adaptive tools for art)?
Do you miss any specific creative outlet, and is there an adaptation that might help (like voice-controlled music software, adaptive art tools)?
Would you be interested in exploring new forms of creative expression that fit your abilities now?

question: How would you describe your overall mood and mental well-being right now?

options.label: Excellent, feeling positive and resilient
Good, occasional worries but mostly okay
Fair, some persistent worries or sadness
Poor, often anxious or down
Very poor, struggling significantly with mood

followup_questions.question: Have you been able to enjoy things lately or do things that typically improve your mood?
Do you feel you have enough support for your emotional well-being (friends, family, counseling)?
Would you say your mental health has changed recently, and would you like resources to address that change?

question: Have you been engaging in any physical therapy or exercise routines, and how do you feel they are benefiting you?

options.label: Yes, regularly and it’s very beneficial
Yes, somewhat regularly; somewhat helpful
Not regularly; minimal benefits noticed
Tried but currently not doing any; didn’t see much benefit
No, not doing any PT or exercise

followup_questions.question: What kind of exercises or therapy have you tried, if any?
Do you have any barriers to exercising (like lack of energy, pain, or access to a therapist)?
Would you like advice on gentle exercises or stretches that could be done at home safely?

question: Do you feel safe and secure in your daily life (for example, no fear of falling, no abuse or neglect from anyone)?

options.label: Yes, I feel completely safe and secure
Mostly safe, minor worries
Some safety concerns (occasional falls or worries)
Significant safety concerns (frequent falls or other issues)
I do not feel safe/secure at all in daily life

followup_questions.question: Have you had any recent falls or accidents?
Do you ever feel mistreated or not cared for properly by anyone in your life?
Would you like to review safety measures at home or talk about any concerns you have about your personal safety?

question: Are you experiencing any pain that is not well controlled?

options.label: No, not experiencing significant pain
Mild pain, present but manageable
Moderate pain that sometimes limits activities
Severe pain often, hard to control
Extreme pain, uncontrolled

followup_questions.question: What areas or types of pain do you experience most (muscles, joints, etc.)?
Are you taking any pain relief medications or using other pain management techniques (like heat pads, massage)?
Would you like to discuss improving pain control or trying new pain management strategies?

question: How much does pain interfere with your daily activities or sleep?

options.label: Not at all, pain doesn’t interfere
A little bit, rarely affects activities/sleep
Some, pain sometimes changes my plans or sleep
A lot, pain frequently limits what I do or my sleep
Extremely, pain dictates most of my day

followup_questions.question: Are there certain times of day or activities that trigger your pain more?
Does pain wake you up at night or prevent you from falling asleep?
Would you like to explore additional pain relief options (different medications, therapies, etc.)?

question: Do you feel you can still concentrate, think clearly, and make decisions as well as before?

options.label: Yes, cognitive function is as sharp as ever
Mostly yes, just minor changes
Some noticeable difficulties (brain fog or indecision at times)
Significant cognitive difficulties (often feel confused or slow)
Severe cognitive decline (unable to think or decide clearly)

followup_questions.question: Do you experience any "brain fog" or trouble focusing on tasks or conversations?
Are memory issues part of this, or is it more about focusing and decision-making?
Would an evaluation or strategies for cognitive function (like memory aids or mental exercises) interest you if this is a concern?

question: Have you experienced any vision changes or difficulty seeing, whether due to your condition or otherwise?

options.label: No, vision is fine or corrected with glasses
Mild issues (occasionally blurry or strained)
Moderate vision changes (require adaptations like larger print)
Significant vision problems affecting daily tasks
Severe vision loss impacting most activities

followup_questions.question: Do you have any trouble with eye movements or keeping focus (sometimes ALS/MND can affect eye muscles in later stages)?
Have you had a recent eye exam to check on any changes?
Would you like to discuss any assistive devices for vision (like screen readers or magnifiers) if needed?

question: Have you noticed any hearing difficulties or changes?

options.label: No, hearing is fine
Maybe a slight change, but not problematic
Some hearing difficulty (ask people to repeat sometimes)
Significant hearing loss (miss a lot even with repetition)
Severe hearing problems (can’t hear without assistive devices)

followup_questions.question: Have others mentioned you not hearing things, or do you notice needing the TV or phone louder?
Have you had a hearing test or considered hearing aids if needed?
Would you like to look into any hearing assistive devices or strategies if hearing is becoming an issue?

question: Are there any legal or financial documents you’re worried about or think you might need help with (like power of attorney, wills, advanced directives)?

options.label: No, everything is handled or I’m not worried
Maybe one or two items to look into, but mostly okay
Yes, a few things I’m unsure about or need to handle
Yes, many things I haven’t addressed and am concerned about
I haven’t thought about these at all, but probably should

followup_questions.question: Are there specific documents (like a will or power of attorney) that you know you want to work on?
Do you have someone you trust to help with financial or legal matters if you needed assistance?
Would you like to get a referral to legal aid or resources that help with these documents?

question: Are all your medical equipment and devices (wheelchair, ventilator, communication device, etc.) working properly and well-maintained?

options.label: Yes, all equipment is working well
One or two minor issues, but nothing serious
Some equipment issues or maintenance needs attention
Major issues with equipment (frequent malfunctions)
Equipment not functioning or not available when needed

followup_questions.question: Do you have a regular maintenance schedule or someone to fix issues with your equipment?
Is there any backup plan if a crucial device fails (like a spare battery or second device)?
Would you like information on service providers or programs that help with equipment maintenance or repairs?

question: Do you feel connected to a community (local or online) of people who understand what you’re going through?

options.label: Yes, very connected to a supportive community
Somewhat connected; I have a few people or groups
A little; I know of a community but not very engaged
Not much; I feel a bit isolated from such communities
No, I’m not connected to any peer community

followup_questions.question: Are you part of any ALS/MND support groups or online forums?
Do you have opportunities to meet or talk to others with similar experiences?
Would you like to get connected with a community or support group (if not already) for shared understanding and support?
